meanings.definition: A short film presenting current news events.
meanings.sent1: We watched a newsreel about the weather in class.
meanings.sent2: The newsreel at the cinema showed footage of the recent protests.
meanings.sent3: The newsreel made the class laugh when it showed a silly cat video.
meanings.sent4: Her life felt like a newsreel, constantly changing and full of surprises.
meanings.sent5: The newsreel was so vivid, it felt like we were right there at the scene.

meanings.definition: A reel of film containing a newsreel.
meanings.sent1: The old cinema stored a newsreel in its archives.
meanings.sent2: He found a dusty newsreel in the attic while cleaning.
meanings.sent3: The newsreel in the basement seemed to have a life of its own.
meanings.sent4: The newsreel was a treasure trove of historical footage.
meanings.sent5: The newsreel gleamed with the promise of forgotten stories.
